wikipedia_page.main: John Bonfoy Rooper (8 August 1778 – March 1855) was a British Member of Parliament.

response: * August 8 – John Bonfoy Rooper, British landowner, MP (d. 1855)

Abbots Ripton Hall belonged in the 1800s to the Rooper family. John Bonfoy Rooper was MP for Huntingdonshire from 1831 to 1837 and High Sheriff of Cambridgeshire and Huntingdonshire.  It is now the seat of John Fellowes, 4th Lord De Ramsey.

link_mentions.page: List of United Kingdom MPs: R

response: * Hon. Harriet Georgiana Lucia Agar-Ellis (1867–1928), who married Capt. Thomas Granville Knox, only son of Col. Hon. William Knox MP (second son of Thomas Knox, 2nd Earl of Ranfurly) and Georgiana Rooper (youngest daughter of John Bonfoy Rooper of Abbots Ripton), in 1897.

Knox married in 1856 Georgiana Rooper, daughter of John Bonfoy Rooper, of Ripton Hall, Huntingdon. They had several children. He died at Cheltenham on 16 February 1900, aged 73. His wife survived him by 26 years and died in November 1926.

response: In 1845, Leventhorpe married Louisa Rooper, daughter of John Bonfoy Rooper. Rooper Leventhorpe (1850–1940) was their son.
